definition: difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: Do not misconstrue it as an effort to exert force or pressure.
sentences.chinese: 不要把它誤解爲需要卯盡全力或施加壓力的苦差事。

sentences.english: Norman and I were deputed for the unpleasant task.
sentences.chinese: 我和諾曼被委派去幹這件苦差事。

sentences.english: Remembering so a lot new phrases is really exert work.
sentences.chinese: 記住這麼多新英語字詞真是件苦差事。

sentences.english: Work without love is a slavery.
sentences.chinese: 沒有愛的工作是一件苦差事。

sentences.english: That's a bummer. Does he sit still and let you brush them?
sentences.chinese: 感覺是件苦差事。你家的狗會乖乖不動讓你刷牙嗎？

sentences.english: Young men revel in doing dangerous tasks.
sentences.chinese: 年輕小夥子特別喜歡幹有危險性的苦差事。

sentences.english: “Without concrete and desirable goals, a budget is just drudgery, ” Rich said.
sentences.chinese: 沒有穩固和滿意的目標，預算就會成爲一件苦差事。

sentences.english: I'm actually thankful that the quad doesn't handle this chore for me.
sentences.chinese: 我其實感到欣慰的是四不處理這個苦差事我。

sentences.english: Being an investment bank analyst is a tough job.
sentences.chinese: 在投資銀行做分析師是一份苦差事。

sentences.english: Indeed, learning is a sub-grind, is tired.
sentences.chinese: 確實，學習是一分苦差事，是累的。

sentences.english: Find hard work you love doing.

definition: hard task/difficult mission/arduous and unrewarding undertaking/drudgery/grind/chore
erhua variant of 苦活[ku3 huo2]
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
good action, deed, thing or work (also sarcastic, "a fine thing indeed")/charity/happy occasion/Daoist or Buddhist ceremony for the souls of the dead
